alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Coastal Rockingham; Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Grafton; Strafford; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 04 at 3:08AM EST until March 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWSTORM THROUGH TODAY... .A winter storm tracking offshore of southern New England today will bring a period of locally heavy snowfall rates to south-central New Hampshire and southwestern Maine through this morning. Snowfall rates will then temporarily decrease late this morning before increasing again for a few hours this afternoon as low pressure strengthens offshore. Wet snow may also fall along the coasts of Maine and New Hampshire. Additionally, strong gusty winds along the coastal plain and into the interior are expected. When combined with wet snow, this may lead to power outages and when combined with drier snow, would produce localized whiteout conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and sleet. Additional snow accumulations between 6 and 11 inches for a storm total of 8 to 14 inches and sleet accumulations between one tenth and two tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
